divs: sighting details my friend and i were "observing" with a 15cm(6")newtonian telescope and large binoculars, looking at star clusters, "m" objects,and the like. my friend who was holding the 70mm binos pointed north with a sweep of his arm and raised the binocular to his eyes. i saw a large (but not bright) triangular shaped object passing overhead. he passed me the binos and i saw the object for about 10 more seconds, as it became fainter and disappeared into the northeast. i had the impression (through the binos)that the large object was made up of a number of smaller triangular objects. there was no sound of any kind,(such as you would expect to hear from migratory birds such as geese,or a formation of aircraft). my feeling was that the object (or objects) were only faintly illuminated by the lights of my small town.it had a dull gray quality. my friend and i were experienced amateur astronomers, with hundreds of hours of time spent at the eyepieces of our telescopes and binos. we were completely baffled by this unexpected sighting. lastly, i believe the object subtended about 1 and 1\2 degrees,or about three times the apparent diameter of the moon.
Summary: large triangular object passed over my friend and me
trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Dubuque
There were no other sightings in Dubuque on or around July 31st 1967
